At this place Ι sent two men into the country to see if the king or any cities were to be found. These returned in three days, having discovered a great number of towns, but all of them small, and without any government. ln the meantime Ι had learned from certain Indians whoml had taken here that this country was an island. Ι returned along the coast to the east, a distance of three hundred and twenty—two miles, which brought me to the extremity of the island. Here Ι discov- ered to the East another island, fifty-four miles from juana.
